[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Did you look for tickets to visit me?
I have been watching the airfare. I'm waiting for the prices to go down a little. How's the weather there this week?
It's lovely this week! Clear skies and sunshine every single day
That sounds nice. It's been rainy here. Are there any good concerts coming up that you plan to see? Maybe I can plan my visit around that if the flights come through

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Visiting Alaska', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B confirms finding suitable flights to visit Alaska and plans to attend a concert while there.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Wow, sign me up! I better get a ticket. Lets go to a concert while I'm there.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Activities in Alaska', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and B discuss plans for the visit including concerts, outdoor activities, and wildlife experiences.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Sure thing! We can cram into my smart cart and I will make you poached eggs every morning for breakfast. We will have a balst! ### Speaker B: That sounds as fun as it will be to finally get to pet a wolf. Maybe we could do eggs just one day? ### Speaker A: Haha. Eggs only day is fine! I will take you on a tour and we can take sleds pulled by our dogs. ### Speaker B: That sounds amazing. i'll check priceline tonight.  ### Speaker A: Do you want to go to folk or indie concert or both? I will get our tickets ready. ### Speaker B: I think a folk concert. I'm more excited about seeing the outdoors. I definitely want to go on a glacier tour ### Speaker A: We will do all the guided tours in the daytime and folk concerts at night. I am going to make sure you have a great time.' }
